list.name: evidence
list.definition: According to the Bible, "faith is the substance of things hoped for, the ____ of things not seen."

list.name: seen
list.definition: Jesus said the ones who are blessed are those who have not ____ but yet believe.

list.name: revealed, merely
list.definition: Faith is to assent to all the truths that God has ____ though it is not ____ to do this.

list.name: entrust, relationship
list.definition: Faith is to ____ oneself totally to God, which is why it is about a ____ with God,

list.name: Amen
list.definition: The word ____ means “Yes, it is true.”

list.name: Church
list.definition: Faith is not merely personal, but ecclesial. It is the ____ that believes.

list.name: gift
list.definition: Faith is a free ____ offered to everyone, but it must be received and “opened.”

list.name: human
list.definition: Faith is a fully ____ because it involves the intellect and the will of a person.

list.name: blind
list.definition: Faith is NOT a ____ leap (rather a “step” which-we have reasons to take).

list.name: contrary
list.definition: Faith is NOT ____ to reason, but builds upon and perfects reason.

list.name: universal
list.definition: Faith is not simply subjective, but includes objective and ____ claims about reality.

list.name: questions, enrich
list.definition: Faith and science answer different ____; they are not opposed to but mutually ____ one another.

list.name: matures
list.definition: Faith is dynamic — it always grows and ____.

list.name: supernatural
list.definition: Faith is a ____ virtue.

list.name: truth, deceive, deceived
list.definition: The ACT OF FAITH states that we believe all that God has revealed because God is ____ itself and cannot ____ nor be ____.

list.name: science
list.definition: Theology is the ____ of faith, according to St. Thomas Aquinas.

list.name: known
list.definition: Theology deduces unknown truths from ____ ones and certain principles by means of correct conclusions.

list.name: revelation
list.definition: The theologian receives and believingly embraces the infallible truths of Divine ____.

list.name: doctrine
list.definition: The theologian erects the foundation of these infallible truths a logical body of ____, by means of logical construction, systematic grouping, and correct deductions.

list.name: science
list.definition: Theology is the ____ of faith, according to St. Thomas Aquinas.

list.name: known
list.definition: Theology deduces unknown truths from ____ ones and certain principles by means of correct conclusions.

list.name: revelation
list.definition: The theologian receives and believingly embraces the infallible truths of Divine ____.

list.name: doctrine
list.definition: The theologian erects the foundation of these infallible truths a logical body of ____, by means of logical construction, systematic grouping, and correct deductions.

list.name: elaboration
list.definition: Theology is a reflective and scientific ____ of the understanding of God’s Word in light of faith, according to St. John Paul Ill.

list.name: understanding
list.definition: Theology is faith seeking ____

list.name: queen
list.definition: Theology is first among the sciences; it is called the ____ of the sciences.

list.name: certitude, supernatural
list.definition: Two reasons that theology is first among the sciences are because of the ____ it ensures being based in truth directly revealed by God, and — it guides human beings beyond merely this world to his ____ end.

list.name: relationship
list.definition: God reveals Himself to us because He desires a ____ with us.

list.name: Apostolic
list.definition: Divine Revelation is passed down to us through ____

list.name: Tradition
list.definition: The Word of God (Divine Revelation) passed on orally is called Sacred ____

list.name: Scripture
list.definition: The Word of God (Divine Revelation) passed on in writing is called Sacred ____

list.name: Pope, bishops
list.definition: The official teaching of the Church is made up of the ____ and the ____ , the successors of Peter and the Apostles.

list.name: Magisterium, faith
list.definition: The task of authentically interpreting the Word of God whether passed on orally or in writing belongs exclusively to the ____ which is guided to all truth by the Holy Spirit. It is responsible for safeguarding and preserving the sacred deposit of ____.

list.name: exists, reveal
list.definition: We can know some things about God by reason alone, like that He ____ but this knowledge is not enough have a relationship with Him. This is why God needs to ____ Himself to us.

list.name: inspired
list.definition: We believe that the Holy Spirit ____ the Sacred Scriptures.
